quotes.quote: Interest is the spur of the people, but glory that of great souls. Invention is the talent of youth, and judgment of age.
To wakenÂ interestÂ and kindle enthusiasm is the sure way to teach easily and successfully.
If you always do whatÂ interestÂ you, then at least one person is pleased.
It is hard to interest those who have everything in those who have nothing.
Interest does not tie nations together; it sometimes separates them. But sympathy and understanding does unite them.
TheÂ interests we share as human beings are far more powerful than the forces that drive us apart.

Develop anÂ interestÂ in life as you see it; the people, things, literature, music - the world is so rich, simply throbbing with rich treasures, beautiful souls and interesting people. Forget yourself.
CommonÂ interestÂ may always be reckoned upon as the surest bond of sympathy.
Let us ever remember that our interest is in concord, not in conflict; and that our real eminence rests in the victories of peace, not those of war.
Your deepÂ interests should always have a dog-eared place on your nightstand.
People's interest is in the product, not in its authorship.
TheÂ interestÂ of the landlord is always opposed to theÂ interests of every other class in the community.
In the long run, the public interest depends on private virtue.
Our ownÂ interests are still an exquisite means for dazzling our eyes agreeably.
The rate of interest acts as a link between income-value and capital-value.
IntenseÂ interestÂ in any subject is indispensable if you're really going to excel in it.
Self-interestÂ leads to honing your skills, the better to trade with.
GreatÂ interests demand great safeguards.
Self-interest, be it enlightened, works indirectly for the public good.
It is vain to talk of theÂ interestÂ of the community, without understanding what is theÂ interestÂ of the individual.
InterestÂ blinds some people, and enlightens others.
The greatÂ interests of man: air and light, the joy of having a body, the voluptuousness of looking.
InterestÂ makes all seem reason that leads to it.
InterestÂ is the most important thing in life; happiness is temporary, butÂ interestÂ is continuous.
We interest others by the misfortune we spread around us.
Half theÂ interestÂ of a garden is the constant exercise of the imagination.
When you loseÂ interestÂ in anything, you also lose the memory for it.
It is always great when people take interest in your work.
SomeÂ interests have got a footing on the earth which we have not made sufficient allowance for.
A lowerÂ interestÂ rate doesn't make a debt go away.
SelfishÂ interestÂ is one of the most common obstructions to the advance of truth.
A man'sÂ interestÂ in the world is only an overflow from hisÂ interestÂ in himself.
AllÂ interestÂ in disease and death is only another expression ofÂ interestÂ in life.
Don't beÂ interesting, beÂ interested.
EmpiricalÂ interestÂ will be in the facts so far as they are relevant to the solution of these problems.
The general interest of the masses might take the place of the insight of genius if it were allowed freedom of action.
